intro: Oenanthe calycina, commonly known as the narrow-leaved water dropwort, is a herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as stream banks and wet meadows. The plant has slender, branched stems and small, arrowhead-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are tiny, greenish-white, and clustered in umbels, which are characteristic of the Apiaceae family. Oenanthe calycina is known for its delicate appearance and its ability to thrive in wetland habitats.
